mods.abstract: Female Child, composition head and body, mohair wig short and curl front, braided back, swivel neck, sleeping eyes with lashes, open mouth with four upper teeth, jointed at shoulders, hips, white under-dress, plaid short dress, white pinafore, black leather shoes with off-white socks, machine-made, McGuffey Ann, Miss McGuffy, a contemporary American doll, is named for William Holmes McGuffey's 'Electric Reader' which was used in American Elementary schools from 1836-1857. The Ann McGuffey dolls came about 1937 to commemorate 100th anniversary of the famous primer.""
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
